result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon James Snider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts 2 and 3 read-in and dismissed.
Defendant to sign up for Probation today July 9, 2014 by 1:00 p.m.
Court notes 21 days credit against ultimate sentence.

  

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Vlack, DAR, Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon A Correll   DF ATTY:  Mark D Biller   DF:  Brandon James Snider appeared. Case called at 1:06 pm. There is an agreement. Amended information was filed by the State. PSI is requested by ADA Correll. A COMPAS was already filled out. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Amended Count #1.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Amended Count #1. Counts 2 and 3 are read in and dismissed. Court orders PSI. COMPAS does not need to be redone. Address is confirmed. Bond continues. Jury Trial can be taken off. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Court trial on May 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.

__ SIGNATURE BOND:   __ Defendant and/or  _X_ Surety Lisa Leshrke guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $7500.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Indue Sales and Services, Tom S or employees, Devon B or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-No Possession of Firearms 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Def to reside in River Falls or with his mother. km  Court trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.

CO: Vlack, Rept. Kasten, Clerk: Feuerhelm, ADA: Sharon Correll, DF ATTY: Mark Drew Biller, DF: Brandon James Snider appeared from jail.  Case called at 9:35 a.m.  S/T SCC Deputy T. Williams.  Direct by ADA Correll.  Cross.  Redirect.  Witness released.  S/T SCC Investigator C. Rose.  Direct by ADA Correll.  Atty. Biller stipulates to identification of Defendant.  Cross.  Defendant released.  ADA Correll moves for bindover.  Crt. makes findings; sufficient probable cause that a felony was committed and binds Defendant over for trial.  ADA Correll presents Information, Atty. Biller reserves on motions.  Crt. proceeds w/Arraignment.  Crt. informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands.  Atty. Biller enters NG pleas and requests to address bond.  Crt. will allow.  Atty. Biller states position and requests signature bond.  ADA Correll objects and states concerns.  Crt. questions residence, mother's residence (Polk Co.) and questions possibility of COMPAS evaluation as to bond reconsideration.  Atty. Biller and Defendant agree to evaluation.  ADA Correll responds.  Crt. will see how long evaluation would take and sets for continued hearing.  Bond continues.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
